channel.title: Portfolio website for Olivia Wang
channel.description: Recent content on Portfolio website for Olivia Wang

item.title: COVID-19 Data Insights
item.description: Let us look at CDC Covid-19 Case Surveillance Data. There are well over 3 million entries of individual, de-identified patient data. # URL link to CDC to download data url <- "https://data.cdc.gov/api/views/vbim-akqf/rows.csv?accessType=DOWNLOAD" covid_data <- vroom(url)%>% clean_names() # covid_data <- read_csv(here::here('data', 'COVID-19_Case_Surveillance_Public_Use_Data.csv.zip')) %>% # clean_names() Given the data we have, I would produce two graphs that show death % rate: 1. by age group, sex, and whether the patient had co-morbidities or not covid_chart_one <- covid_data %>% # Manually delete data with values that are "Missing", "Unknown" as well as "Other" for gender filter(sex !

item.title: Omega Group plc- Pay Discrimination
item.description: At the last board meeting of Omega Group Plc., the headquarters of a large multinational company, the issue was raised that women were being discriminated in the company, in the sense that the salaries were not the same for male and female executives. A quick analysis of a sample of 50 employees (of which 24 men and 26 women) revealed that the average salary for men was about 8,700 higher than for women.

item.title: Trump’s Approval Margins
item.description: As we saw in class, fivethirtyeight.com has detailed data on all polls that track the president’s approval. # Import approval polls data approval_polllist <- read_csv(here::here('data', 'approval_polllist.csv')) # or directly off fivethirtyeight website # approval_polllist <- read_csv('https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/trump-approval-data/approval_polllist.csv') glimpse(approval_polllist) ## Rows: 15,619 ## Columns: 22 ## $ president <chr> "Donald Trump", "Donald Trump", "Donald Trump",... ## $ subgroup <chr> "All polls", "All polls", "All polls", "All pol... ## $ modeldate <chr> "9/27/2020", "9/27/2020", "9/27/2020", "9/27/20.

item.title: Yield Curve inversion
item.description: Data preparation Every so often, we hear warnings from commentators on the “inverted yield curve” and its predictive power with respect to recessions. An explainer what a inverted yield curve is can be found here. If you’d rather listen to something, here is a great podcast from NPR on yield curve indicators In addition, many articles and commentators think that, e.g., Yield curve inversion is viewed as a harbinger of recession.
